page.title: 19The Enviroment 2
page.content: There are a few badgers near the school and in the valley although most of them life on the hillside.Often there are foxes which raid the bins and farms hoping to catch something to eat.In the spring the first flower of the year is the snowdrop, later comes the daffodils then the blue bells, primroses and cow parsley comes later.The fox gloves come later.During the last winter,the Red Kite,a rare bird of prey was seen daily in our area looking for food.The most comman bird of prey is the Buzzard and these nest freely in the oak wood and some of the higher fir trees near the school.The natural wildlife of our area is very much unditurbed,the only disturbance is the occasional tractor or aeroplane.
